project.teaser: The emergence of complex urban mobility environments where unknown interactions between different types of vulnerable road users (VRUs) and between VRUs and motorised vehicles poses the need for a clear understanding of user behaviours, fair and optimised use of public spaces...
project.objective: The emergence of complex urban mobility environments where unknown interactions between different types of vulnerable road users (VRUs) and between VRUs and motorised vehicles poses the need for a clear understanding of user behaviours, fair and optimised use of public spaces as well as age friendly urban safety action plans and assessments, capitalising on the benefits that technological innovations and the plethora of available data can offer in advanced accident analysis, towards achieving EU’s ‘Vision Zero’ for zero fatalities in road transport by 2050. SOTERIA aims to accelerate the attainment of this Vision for VRUs through a holistic framework of innovative models, tools and services that enable data driven urban safety intelligence, facilitate safe travelling of VRUs and foster the safe integration of micro-mobility services in complex environments. At the operational level SOTERIA uncovers unexplored behavioural characteristics of VRUs and engages Living Lab communities in social innovation activities for the co-creation of urban safety solutions and infrastructure designs. Simulation models and explainable AI driven analytics are developed for supporting policy decisions and informing interconnected services that support VRUs in safe and clean travelling. On-vehicle sensors and connectivity are fostered enabling minimisation of risky situations and behaviours. The approach is validated in four thematic demonstrations and through the SOTERIA network of eight cities, addressing different types of VRUs.
project.title: Systematic and orchestrated deployment of safety solutions in complex urban environments for ageing and vulnerable societies
project.keywords: behavioural modeling, social innovation, explainable AI, mobility demand prediction, C-ITS, micro-vehicle telematics, Safe Routing, behavioural change systems, space modelling, accident analysis

result.title: Dissemination/Communication Strategy & Kit / Activities Report
result.description: This will include the communication dissemination and liaison plan to be followed within the project including the plan for the engagement activities related to collaboration with other projects and workshops organized to discuss disseminate and demonstrate results It will be updated every year The communication kit describes and presents the project brand identity and material the leafletbrochure posters rollup newsletters videos website and social media accounts It will be issued at different dates according to the project needs and communication planning Reports the results of project dissemination and communication activities including the actions related to cooperation with other projects and the advisory board and standardization activitiesT51

result.title: Data Management Plan
result.description: Covers the data management plan and data quality related parameters, how data will be collected, stored, accessed, exchanged, as well as data approved for publication can be used by others. (Task 5.2)

result.title: A Graph Data Model Creation Methodology for Accident Hotspot Prediction in Urban Areas

details.authors: Jon Díaz, Gabriel Duflo, Jenny Fajardo, Enrique Onieva, Antonio David Masegosa
details.journalTitle: Lecture Notes in Computer Science, Hybrid Artificial Intelligent Systems

result.title: Learning material and output of co-creation activities
result.description: A technical report describing the learning material for VRUs safety and the output of co-creation activities. This deliverable relates to the work undertaken in T1.2

result.title: VRUs and micro-mobility safety services V1
result.description: First (Alpha) release of the sensors developed in T3.1, and services developed in T3.2 - T3.4. The deliverable describes the detailed design of the services and is accompanied by corresponding software implementations.

result.title: Dissemination/Communication Strategy & Kit / Activities Report version 2
result.description: This will include the communication, dissemination and liaison plan to be followed within the project, including the plan for the engagement activities related to collaboration with other projects and workshops organised to discuss, disseminate and demonstrate results. It will be updated every year. The communication kit describes and presents the project brand identity and material, the leaflet/brochure, posters roll-up, newsletters, videos, website and social media accounts. It will be issued at different dates, according to the project needs and communication planning. Reports the results of project dissemination and communication activities including the actions related to cooperation with other projects and the advisory board and standardisation activities (T5.1).

result.title: Micromobility Sensing Systems and Safety Services: A Brief Review

details.authors: Adel Almohammad, Panagiotis Georgakis, Suresh Renukappa

result.title: Road safety of micro-mobility and vulnerable road users: Insights and issues from a world café

details.authors: Gargy M. Sudhakaran, Colin A. Booth, Abhinesh Prabhakaran, Samuel J. Abbey, Panagiotis Georgakis, Suresh Renukappa, Subashini Suresh, Babis Magoutas, Marina Georgiou, Dorine Karvouniari-Matzakou, Maria Pohle, Nora Strauzenberg, Vanessa S. Hilse, Nimalan Chandranesan, Ruth Anderson

result.title: Evaluation of the first round of demonstrations
result.description: Evaluation report highlighting the problems / needed adjustments identified within the first round of demonstrations (T4.1-T4.5).

result.title: State of the Art update and Knowledge Base of best practices
result.description: Updated review of the SOTA in the scientific areas of SOTERIA and knowledge base of best practices, lessons learnt and impacts, to understand and examine different approaches to accident analysis and road safety strategies.Deliverable relates to the work undertaken in T1.1

result.title: Navigating urban futures: Crafting an experimental framework for eye-tracking integrated virtual reality in co-creative planning

details.authors: Gargy M Sudhakaran, Abhinesh Prabhakaran, Colin A Booth, Samuel Abbey, Abdul-Majeed Mahamadu, Panos Georgakis, Maria Pohle, Vanessa S. Hilse
details.journalTitle: Applications of Immersive Technology in Architecture, Engineering and Construction (AEC): A Handbook

result.title: Requirements and SOTERIA architecture
result.description: A technical report describing the user requirements as identified in T1.2 and T1.3, including VRUs behavioural analysis and a description of the SOTERIA conceptual and technical architecture driving the integration of the solutions specified in WP2 and WP3.

result.title: User information services V1
result.description: First (Alpha) release of the SOTERIA user facing applications. The deliverable describes the design of the services integration and is accompanied by corresponding software implementation (T3.5).

result.title: Safe mobility data space and simulation platform
result.description: First (Alpha) release of the safe mobility data space (T2.1), accident modelling and simulation of safe solutions (T2.2).

result.title: Psycho-behavioural determinants of vulnerable road user safety: a review

details.authors: Gargy M. Sudhakaran, Colin A. Booth, Abhinesh Prabhakaran, Samuel Abbey, Panagiotis Georgakis, Suresh Renukappa, Subashini Suresh, Maria Pohle, Vanessa S. Hilse
details.journalTitle: Proceedings of the Institution of Civil Engineers - Transport

result.title: SOTERIA frameworks for safer urban environments
result.description: A technical report describing the structure, and the components of the integrated assessment framework of the project. This deliverable relates to the work undertaken in T1.4.

result.title: Demonstrations planning guidelines
result.description: A set of guidelines and methodological details for the successful implementation of the SOTERIA demonstrations including data management and safety aspects (T4.1).

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - SOTERIA (Systematic and orchestrated deployment of safety solutions in complex urban environments forageing and vulnerable societies)
result.teaser: Although the European roads are the safest in the world, 20 634 people lost their lives in 2022 with almost 70% of fatalities in urban areas being vulnerable road users (VRUs). The EC has adopted the Road Safety Policy Framework 2021 – 2030, as part of its efforts to halve...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Explainable accident and demand prediction analytics
result.description: First (Alpha) release of the accident and demand prediction analytics with infused explainability (T2.3, T2.4).

category.title: sensors
category.displayCode: /engineering and technology/electrical engineering, electronic engineering, information engineering/electronic engineering/sensors

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
